reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderfull hotel,quiet located,near vaporetto and ideal to explore Venice.Hotel management very nice and helpfull..Delicious breakfast,quiet,nice rooms.Nice restaurants in the neighbourhood. We surely return!
reviews.title: Could not be better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled to the Al Duca in Venice to surprise a friend for his 40th birthday. Lovely hotel, if some what hard to find! Elegant lobby, spacious rooms and friendly staff. Breakfast OK but not a great selection compared to other Italian hotels I have stayed in Rome, Milan and Florence. Restaurants and bars nearby are lovely, especially the Al Prosecco bar - where there was impromptu Argentine Tango dancing in the square - magical! Went to Harry's bar for a treat - don't bother unless you have deep pockets!!! There are much nicer places to sip a Bellini I can assure you....All in all Venice is a dream......
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights.
reviews.title: Will recommend..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reached Venice train station late in the night and decided to walk to the hotel. But even with a very detailed map, we had some trouble finding the location.
reviews.title: This is a great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The guy at the reception was pretty friendly and suggested many must-see places in the area and even took the pains to mark them on the map.
reviews.title: Amazing stay in gorgeous hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on TA and we and our travel friends were thrilled with my choice! Pretty rooms, friendly staff who made us dinner reservations at fantastic restaurants, and overall a pleasant experience. We will stay here again!
reviews.title: Wonderful Small boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: We chose this hotel purely on TA reviews. We were not disappointed. Warm welcome, room was big and comfortable. Location was perfect, quiet but can explore main attractions by walking. We will stay here again on our next visit.
reviews.title: Cosy, convenient, friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Immaculately clean. Efficient service. Terrific breakfast. Awesome bathroom. Damask upholstered walls are luxurious and insulating. Close to train and an easy boat ride to/from the airport.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights from the 16th April. We had the red superior room, it was beautifully decorated will a typical venezian feel. Extremely clean, breakfast was basic and continental. Staff were friendly at the reception and very informative. The hotel is situated on a quiet street, about a 15 minute walk to the main attractions.
reviews.title: Fantastic, beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Venice - is beautiful but it is also very expensive 12 euro for a can of coke and lemonade!!!!! We found a small shop and brought the same cans for 49 cents and sat along the canal instead of a cafe.
reviews.title: Great hotel in fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: you can find the hotel easily, not very near to San Marco but hotel, room, furnitures are good. breakfast is not bad, not very good.
reviews.title: If you dont want to stay near to canal, it's good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Mother and I had an amazing time!! The service was very good!! The manager, Catherina was very nice and helpful. We stayed in a room with external bathroom but it was not a problem at all!! We strong recommend Al Duca Di Venezia hotel for you next trip to Venice!!
reviews.title: We strong recommend Al Duca Di Venezia hotel for you next trip to Venice!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: As pictured on the internet, the "red room" is a true indication of spaciousness. Huge and luxurious bedroom and bathroom (both very clean), with deep bath and good water pressure on the shower! Room bright when needed, and dark when necessary. Quiet location, away from the hustle and bustle. Easy to find as it is next to the Natural History Museum. Vaporetto stop on Riva di Biasio approximately 250m from hotel and only one stop from Ferrovia train station. Majer bakery on Calle Larga 100m from hotel - cheap, delicious food, friendly staff. La Zucca, scrumptious vegetarian food approximately 100m from hotel. Fair distance from major sights, though vaporetti are useful for getting around. Breakfast not served until 8am, which is not helpful if you would like an early start to your sightseeing day.
reviews.title: Luxury in a peaceful location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in Venice and Hotel Al Duca was so amazing. We truly felt like royalty in our room for 4 with all of the red velvet finishings. It was very beautiful and quiet. The free breakfast was great-especially the cappucino! Very clean and comfortable and a good location in Santa Croce-which is not in a high tourist area, but great restaurants less than 5 minutes walk away. It was about a 10 minute walk to the train station, and about a 20 minute walk to St. Mark's square, but it's so great just to wander through all of those wonderful little streets in Venice. In the 16 days we were gone, Venice was probably our favorite stop.
reviews.title: Wow-we felt like royalty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An 8 minute walk from the train station (P. Roma) following the "yellow signs" for the Natural History Museum gets you easily to this beautiful 300+ year old hotel. It's small (22 rooms) but elegant. We stayed in the very roomy Gold Tone Superior room with a shower. It had a very comfortable King Bed with a Murano Chandelier and very old wood parquait floors. The bathroom was recently remodelled with new fixtures and marble counters. It was very quiet since it's in the middle of a neighborhood. It's steps away from both a Vaporetto stop and a Traghetto and a 8 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. You can walk anywhere in Venice from this hotel in 30 minutes or less! The breakfasts were good (especially the blood oranges, the prosciutto, and the pastries) . There is a great restaurant that is 1-2 minutes away (La Zucca) and a wonderful little grocery store with good inexpensive wines, gelato, and a great tiramisu for only 2.5 euro (It's called Majer). Highly Recommended!
reviews.title: Beautiful Rooms and Hotel in Quiet Santa Croce

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We made our reservation 6 months in advance, based on the TA reviews, and are glad we did. The hotel is new/newly renovated, with beautiful decor, marble bathrooms, elegant linens and Venetian chandeliers in all of the rooms. The location was excellent for us - near a vaporetto stop and the train station, in a quiet area of Santa Croce not too near the San Marco tourist mayhem. The hotel staff accommodated without a fuss a special request we made (our daughters weren't comfortable sleeping in the same king size bed, so the hotel re-made the bed as two single beds). We arrived at the hotel before check-in time, but they held our bags and had moved them to our room by the time we returned from a walk in Venice. The free wifi worked great in our 2nd floor (European 1st floor) room. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking an elegant stay and attentive service in Venice.
reviews.title: Delightful, luxurious and welcoming.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small, friendly and beautifully appointed hotel proved to be a marvellous base for a relaxing long weekend of fun, great food and hours and hours of incredible sightseeing in the magical city of Venice! Situated almost on the banks of the Grand Canal adjacent to the National History Museum (follow the signs if youever feel lost) this 22 room hotel is really special. The service at the hotel Reception Desk and in the breakfast room is polite, professional, knowlegeable and friendly at all times. The bedrooms are spotlessly clean, spacious and elegantly furnished - even to the extent of having fine glass chandeliers. I cannot recommend it highly enough.
reviews.title: A little jewel of a hotel in a unique city full of enchanting sights, sounds and places to see.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel should be 5 star. It made our trip all the more special... The decor and cleanliness of the room was excellent and the staff were extremely friendly. They couldnt do enough for you.. The breakfast was very nice, even though there wasn't a huge selection, there was enough choice to suit everyone. I would definatly recommend this hotel, and if I were to go back to venice would definatly stay here. Added extras were that they provided you with a detailed map on your arrival, pointing out all the must see places, recommended resturants (although we didn't try them) and there is free internet access in the hotel with a pass code they provide you with at reception.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel really has all you need ,Good service,great staff nothing too much trouble, clean fantastic rooms, quite location.in this case small really is beautiful only 11 rooms.I and my family would really recomend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend and would visit again. Staff definitely went that extra mile for your comfort and enjoyment during your stay, nothing was too much trouble for them.
reviews.title: Excellent quality Hotel, very clean and comfortable.
